trend_summary: Built-up villages stay small and scattered. 2000sâ€“mid period show steady forest recovery, while the latest scene reveals marked canopy loss and browning over the northern highlands. Cultivated patches in the south-east expand slightly into former scrub. Road layout is stable; no major new infrastructure appears. Overall pattern remains predominantly natural and rural.
notable_changes: Gradual forest regrowth between the first and third images across central zones.
Sharp browning/deforestation in the northern mountains in the latest image, likely fire or clear-cut logging.
Modest enlargement of agricultural fields in the south-eastern lowlands.
Minor infill of existing rural settlements but no new urban centres.
Land cover seasonality becomes more pronounced, indicating changing moisture or management regimes.
